lines.gurmukhi: qus mY qMdul boie inpjY shMsR guno dyh Dwir krq hY praupkwr jI
lines.transliteration_english: Tous Mai Tandul Boi Nipajai Sahansr Gouno , Dayh Dhaari Karat Hai Paraoupakaar Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A grain of rice covered by its husk when sowed yields many time more such grains and as rice (a staple food item) do much good in the world.

lines.gurmukhi: qus mY qMdul inribGn lwgY n Gunu rwKy rhY icrMkwl hoq n ibkwr jI
lines.transliteration_english: Tous Mai Tandul Nirabighan Laagai N Ghounu , Raakhay Rahai Chirankaal Hot N Bikaar Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The rice remains protected against insects as long as it remains in the husk. It remains preserved for long.

lines.gurmukhi: quK sY inkis hoie Bgn mlIn rUp s√çwd krvwie rwDy rhY n sMswr jI
lines.transliteration_english: Toukh Sai Nikasi Hoi Bhagan Maleen Roopa , Svaad Karavaai Raadhay Rahai N Sansaar Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Outside the husk, rice breaks. It acquires a darkish hue and slight bitterness. It loses its worldly importance.

lines.gurmukhi: gur aupdys gurisK giH mY bYrwgI giH qij bn KMf hoq n auDwr jI ]121]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Oupadays Gursikh Grih Mai Bairaagee , Grih Taji Ban Khand Hot N Udhaar Jee ?121?

Shabad OS B.translation: So does a Sikh of Guru following the advice of Guru lives a householder's life without being attached and engrossed in it. He does good to others while living with his family members. He does not renounce the family and lives in jungles to emancipate hims
